website_summaries.verdict: An affordable, feature-rich metronome/tuner from a reputable company.
pros: Offers many functions, including instant transposition
cons: Volume might not be high enough for ensemble work

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the MetroPitch, and had an issue with the Jogwheel which adjusts the tempo. It easily rotated in one direction, but resisted turning in the other! I was really disappointed because in all other aspects this metronome seemed so nicely engineered. Well, the company immediately responded, and shipped me a replacement right away, which works perfectly. In their email they mentioned a goal of 100% customer satisfaction, and they certainly delivered on that. I think my initial one was just a weird exception. I highly recommend the product and the company. Well done!
customer_reviews.author: Mark the RT

customer_reviews.title: Good, but Not Loud Enough
customer_reviews.text: Lots of features and works well. It's a good price, but for the price, the volume on the metronome should be much louder. Hard to hear even in a small room when playing. You definitely need to use headphones...every time. After leaving this review, the seller was kind enough to reach out to me and give me a full refund and forward the information onto their product development team to better the product, even though I did not ask. Great customer service from Kliq. I will definitely buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: OK for tuner, horrible beeping metronome!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nifty device with some good controls for rhythm, tuning and transposition. However, this is positively the WORST most OBNOXIOUS, ear-piercing, headache-inducing, toothache-causing metronome 'click' I've ever heard in my 45years of playing a variety of instruments!! I simply never imagined someone in the musical device business would EVER choose such a sound to represent a tempo count?! It's a shrill, high-pitched 'beep' for the primary tempo. The fill beat sounds actually aren't that bad! Shame you can't swap them for the primary... Good tuner! I gave it to my son to throw in his guitar goodie bag. Not! For acoustic instruments in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: B. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. My daughter needed one for band with certain bells and whistles. This one fit the bill and had an attractive price. Her band teacher even loved it. And in less than a month she broke it. You know, cracked screen just like what happens with cell phones. Functions of it still work but she had no screen. That's not a negative comment; it was her mistreatment of it that led to a broken screen. This is a wonderful product and I was going to purchase another before the band director simply gave her one. So long as it's treated with the care and respect any electronic item should be shown it will work as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah M

customer_reviews.title: This is the ONE!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent choice in the world of portable tuners because of the metronome feature. A necessity for people who really want to excel with their instruments! My 10 yr old son's sax teacher asked him to get a tuner. Since my 13 yr old daughter loves hers and already had this one in blue for her cello, I bought him this in red. Colors are trendy and they use them everyday for home practice and private lessons. They love these tuners/metronomes! They both also play piano for fun and use the metronome feature on this all the time. Couldn't live without..
customer_reviews.author: LMIK

customer_reviews.title: Quick, Easy, Reasonable
customer_reviews.text: Quick, easy, reasonable. What else could you ask for in a tuner? Tunes chromatically, easy to see (changes from red to green), light, compact, inexpensive. Love it. BTW, the protective leatherette case is a nice throw-in! Soft, leather feel, open at one end to allow the tuner to slide in and out. Very posh for the cost of this tuner. One possible con: It has a fairly wide "green" zone...I'd guess about +/- 3 cents (about 7 cents wide). So if you are looking for that "perfect pitch" you've got to gauge where the middle is. For the most part, musicians I know who are that picky about tuning will be tuning by ear anyway...
customer_reviews.author: Pam Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Great tuner/metronome, everything you need!
customer_reviews.text: This tuner/metronome is compact, simple to use, and easily portable. It does everything you need it to do, and gets the job done quickly and efficiently. Pitches settle in and register very quickly. I got mine in red so I can easily find it in the giant black hole that is my bag in which I carry all my horn accessories...and lets face it, us musicians usually have everything in black anyways, so it’s nice to have something that stands out! I’ve had the current set of batteries in for months now and they’re showing no sign of wearing down...and this tuner is used several times a day on many different instruments.
customer_reviews.author: EmporiaHornGirl

customer_reviews.title: Kliq, tuner, metronome
customer_reviews.text: I'm having a great time playing with your kliq metronome, tuner, I've been challenging the band members with the tuner, as a joke of course, the metronome is fantastic for breaking down certain rhythm exercises when I practice, please keep making great music products and I have let musician friends to check out your tuner, metronome products, thank you again fora ggreat tuner, metronome, I'll keep this with me always, Curtis
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Cobb

customer_reviews.title: Great tuner and metronome...
customer_reviews.text: Great tuner and metronome, came on time and works really well and the price isn’t too steep. Some tuners for the same price seem like they don’t calibrate them before leaving the factory. Love the metronome and the little wheel to adjust the bpm and it also has a tone generator and the wheel also controls that and the key it’s in. Definitely recommend and it would help some beginners as well to learn and develop there ear and timing. Overall no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: bfl2125

customer_reviews.title: Nice little tuner/metronome
customer_reviews.text: My previous battery operated tuner finally conked out, so looked into getting a new one. I liked this one because it had the metronome and tuner combined, but also the different tuning settings make tuning easy. I play guitar, mandolin (same as tuning as violin setting) and ukulele, so it was nice to have the standard tuning for all three. I liked having the chromatic tuning option as well for those times playing out of standard tune or when I dabble with other instruments. The functions and switching between each took me a little bit to get used to, but now that I get it, no problems!
customer_reviews.author: Liz P

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: So my old school Korg finally gave out on me. I've tried the tuners that clip on the headstock and every brand I tried was a total waste of money. I decided to give this one a try. It's accurate on my acoustic guitars (3/4 length to full length) and ukelele, my brother's bass, and his electric guitar. It's small enough for me to fit in my purse and hasn't let me down yet. I still keep my Korg around for nostalgia, but I am very pleased with this tuner.
customer_reviews.author: ART

customer_reviews.title: Too many options, just want a tuner.
customer_reviews.text: Not happy. I knew I was going to regret buying this but I wanted to give it, the benefit of the doubt. Best rule, buy a product that does 1 thing well and stick with it. I could barely get this to stay on (Yes I'm aware of the power saving) let alone help me get in tune. I ended up going with a cheap Korg. Does one thing and that is it.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Back fastner falls apart. Batteries keep falling out of the unit. A real problem.
customer_reviews.text: Originally, I gave this tuner a good review. But now the back piece that holds the two batteries in place keeps falling off. I did NO damage to this unit. It is an engineering or manufacturing flaw. This compromises the accuracy of the tuning. It happens all the time. I had to put a piece of tape on it to prevent it from falling off. For the price, I should NOT have to do this. A tuner MUST be accurate and if the back piece that holds in the batteries keeps falling off - accuracy is not going to happen. I would not buy this product again
customer_reviews.author: paul azar

customer_reviews.title: kills batteries
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in October 2018. It seems to work well but my battery run time is really short. the unit I have maybe defective but I put new ones in and use it about fifteen minutes then it sets for a week and turn it on and the batteries are dead.. I put a brand new set in to see how long they would last without using the unit and week later whey I turned it on to see the level remaining. It was flashing low... to bad I didn't realize this before the return deadline, or I would have sent it back..
customer_reviews.author: blaze2200

customer_reviews.title: Died in 4 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this metronome in April, and it decided to simply quit in August. Put in new batteries, twice, incase the batteries were duds. nothing, metronome was dead. Shopping around for another brand now. :(
customer_reviews.author: Felix

customer_reviews.title: Not User Friendly, Does What it Should
customer_reviews.text: Battery-saver turns it on and off during use, which is annoying but it is actually working and will turn back on the screen when you play a note. I like the metronome and the alternate tunings and frequency options. I think there are cheaper tuners that are easier to use but if you are a seasoned musician and want a more complex tool with many functions this could work for you. I use for guitar/bass and singing. The pitch maker function is good too but I rarely use this. I will use this as my primary tuner and metronome even though I have others despite the negative things I've noticed about it.
customer_reviews.author: Milo_Guitarist

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my husband, who is a piano student. We are both enjoying this metronome, which is multi-functional, easy to use, and fairly quiet. It not only has an audible beat, but also uses red and green lights to accent which beat is heaviest (for example, in a waltz 3/4 time, ONE-two-three, ONE-two-three). We thought it was a great value at this price, and meets the needs of the piano student.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia L. Sakrison

customer_reviews.title: Great functionality and a real value
customer_reviews.text: Great little tool. Volume control allows for just the right level of audibility. I'm purely using the metronome and haven't used the tuner yet as I have that in my rig already. Portable, yet sturdy, it's a real bargain. A couple quick observations I would make: 1) The angle of the stand is kind of shallow, I'd prefer it stand a little closer to upright; 2) I'd prefer a click to a beep on the metronome, or at least ability to choose, 3) The fit on the case is a mite snug. It's fine - it just requires some effort to get it in and out of the sleeve.
customer_reviews.author: C. E. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Junk, not worth the money!!!
customer_reviews.text: What’s wrong. More like what isn’t wrong. Volume of the metronome is too low, even at maximum. Bought this for the metronome function really, and you can’t really hear it all if you’re playing your guitar. On the third day I woke up and found out the wheel that controls the tempo of the metronome is missing. Have no idea when it fell off or where. I also tried the tuning function and it’s a pita. Other than that it’s fine. You’re better off installing the Fender Tune app on your phone. Much better tuner, much louder metronome. Save your money!
customer_reviews.author: darkstar64

customer_reviews.title: Solid metronome with easy tempo adjustment
customer_reviews.text: Things I love: The clicky wheel for tempo adjustment. So much better than pushing up and down buttons. Variety of beats and patterns available. LED flashing beat indication. Things that could use improvement: Teeny volume knob on the side is tough to accurately adjust Low battery indicator flashes even with fresh batteries Setting beat patterns uses a combination of Function and Mode buttons, and it's not very intuitive. Only beeps - I'd love clicks. All in all a great metronome!
customer_reviews.author: Nix

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but not great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This seems like a well constructed metronome. But - the batteries went low in about 3 hours. Particularly I did not like how you could not set the accent on particular beats - it always will accent the downbeat of whatever measure type you are in. This can throw you off in particular exercises. Also, too much digital animation on the screen - it made me dizzy when just trying to keep an eye on the digital pendulum in my peripheral vision while practicing; it should just be a simple flash. My recommendation: Use the "Pro Metronome" iOS app for $3.99. I found everything I was looking for in that app.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Best in class metronome!
customer_reviews.text: You will not find a better metronome for this price. The metronome function can be subdivided, As is common practice, there is a pitch generator, but not only that, a tuner too. I have used the tuner with sight singing. There are plenty of apps available for phones, and I have a few, but I really prefer to have this purpose specific device. The battery will last long, and I will have my phone available for other things when I need it.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard D.

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love the fact that it can determine any note that you sing or play very accurately. Very versatile with adjustments for pitch, specific stringed instruments, tempo variations. Highly recommend despite it being a little more expensive than the simple pitch pipes. I will say that the first one I received was defective though. Instead of showing middle F it showed E sharp. OK, they really are the same since F is really only a half tone above E, but there is no such note as E sharp!
customer_reviews.author: Natural Doctor

customer_reviews.title: Good service
customer_reviews.text: My son needs a metronome that can fit into his clarinet case for his school symphonic band practice everyday. The size, functions, and price of this product caught my attention. The product works very well for this first 4.5 months. However, it suddenly stopped working. There is no beeping sound generated unless the volume dial is pressed down hard. I assume that's not the intended design. I am contacting the manufacturer now for a replacement. I hope they will honor their promised 3-year warranty. I will keep this post live until the product issue is addressed. Stay tuned. Update - The seller agreed to send me a replacement. It works well so far
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Z.

customer_reviews.title: Great little metronome..  Would expect it to cost a bit more than it does...
customer_reviews.text: Decided to make myself use a metronome this year in my quest for learning the guitar a bit better and improve my rhythm playing. For the price, you definitely can't beat this little KLIQ metronome / tuner. Excellent build quality, easy to use, loud, and loaded with features. If you need a good metronome and don't want to spend an absolute fortune on one, you will not go wrong with this one in my opinion...
customer_reviews.author: SHAWN

customer_reviews.title: Helps my flute playing
customer_reviews.text: I am a beginner flute player and I needed to know if I was hitting the pitch for the notes in the top octave on the flute. This device has really helped. I'm much more sure of my self now. Also to my embarrassment, I've have discovered that my whistling is sharp. I'll have to work on that.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Slattery

customer_reviews.title: Great tuner function
customer_reviews.text: The best feature by far is the guitar tuner. Easy to see when it's dead center. The metronome is good, but I ended up getting a mechanical version here on Amazon. I seem to be able to anticipate the timing better. Probably different for each person, so get this for the tuner and If the metronome works for you it's a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Dane

customer_reviews.title: KLIQ MetroPitch Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the KLIQ MetroPitch due to the need for a metronome for my guitar lessons. This unit gave me the metronome plus so much more. I really like the big screen which makes it easy to see chords, and check my tuning. The functions, and navigation of buttons and dial is very easy to use. I would not hesitate to purchase again, and recommend the KLIQ MetroPitch to anyone looking for an affordable, all in one tuner and metronome.
customer_reviews.author: DwightP980

customer_reviews.title: Very complicated device.
customer_reviews.text: My KLIQ MetroPitch was returned. I could not get the tuner to function with an acoustic instrument. It registered F# regardless of the string plucked. It also goes into "sleep mode" in seconds, making it necessary to "wake it up" constantly.
customer_reviews.author: Dan H. Kellar

customer_reviews.title: Friendly for Transposing Instruments I especially like its unique feature that lets me set it to ...
customer_reviews.text: Friendly for Transposing Instruments I especially like its unique feature that lets me set it to display pitches correctly for either my B-flat trumpet or my F-horn. It also has settings for E-flat, and of course for Concert pitch. It also does well on all of the typical functions. The added flexibility adds a bit of complexity, but it is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Beam

customer_reviews.title: Buy with confidence
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure if I have the right settings, instructions are little confusing but I bought it for a clarinet and it won’t actually show the note that is playing, it will show the next one.... I initially gave this a 2 stars but was contacted by someone from the company and was provided instructions on how to fix my settings, very helpful and making sure I was happy with the product and even offered me a full refund if needed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Became mute
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for the metronome, the tuner comes in handy. It became mute after less than 1.5 year light use. If I rotate or press the volume wheel in certain way, it gives a couple of sound but won't stay. I think the everything else is still working. But without sound it becomes useless to me. When it works, it is great. But I expect it to last much longer.
customer_reviews.author: X. Li

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of gear, excellent value
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a number of different iPhone apps for tuning my synths and running a metronome. I wanted a standalone tuner that had some flexibility and was roughly the same size as the iPhone. While searching for one, I came across the KLIQ MetroPitch, and saw that it was a tuner, a metronome, a tone generator... basically, a floor wax AND a desert topping! Got it yesterday (fast shipping!) and it is exactly what I wanted. Lightweight, intuitive and accurate. 5 stars, great value
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT W. SAINT JOHN

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Tuner
customer_reviews.text: Our first unit arrived very quickly and was easy to use, however there was a connection problem with the Input jack. I notified the company and they responded by sending a new unit the same day. Excellent customer service. The new unit works perfectly. My daughter has tuned both her regular and bass guitars on her own. Much better than the clip-on units we have used in the past. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Craig Warren

customer_reviews.title: 432 Hz & 444 Hz
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome little tuner! I have been using it in the "C" (Chromatic mode) at 432 Hz and 444 Hz for testing singing bowls. There are healing frequencies and then there is the TOXIC 440 Hz. STOP tuning your instruments to 440 Hz and get with 432 Hz/444 Hz. Do you want to heal people when you play?
customer_reviews.author: friendofYahweh

customer_reviews.title: Tuner and Metronome Great, but no Start/Stop for Metronome
customer_reviews.text: The tuner works great and is accurate. Comparing this to the Korg TM-50 the main design flaw with the Kliq is the lack of start or stop button for the metronome. You can press mute, but that doesn't stop the metronome. The Jog dial is great and useful in tuning and for changing the metronome bpm. A start stop button would have made this perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Sirfiancious

customer_reviews.title: Excellent device
customer_reviews.text: My old Korg tuner kicked the bucket after over a decade of use. The KLIQ is the same size but is much better. The tuner is accurate and sensitive. The lit screen is amazing. The transposing feature, allowing me to see the concert Bb I'm playing on my tenor sax as a C, like on the sheet music I'm reading, is great. Metronome is fine. Great bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Vector

customer_reviews.title: Other pedagogical uses for MetroPitch
customer_reviews.text: I've bought 5 of these for my students and I'll be buying more. MetroPitch has more uses than as a tone generator, tuner, and metronome. I use it for ear-training. One activity, for example, two persons each using tone generator... one person sounds a tone.... the other person using tone generator dials until a match is found...a simpler activity but one students enjoy is to hold two devices side by side and generate tones with one and watch tuner on the other device identify the tone (so I also call the tuner, the identifier).
customer_reviews.author: T. Brotz

customer_reviews.title: Works, but speaker is on the back.
customer_reviews.text: It does exactly what it is supposed to do, with one flaw. The speaker is on the back of the unit, so when you lay it on the music stand, the sound is muted. So it takes some initiative to get it to wear you can hear it. Otherwise it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Randytenn

customer_reviews.title: Good Accurate Tuner
customer_reviews.text: I have not used the Tone generator or Metronome so I cannot rate the volume or tone of the Metronome. However, I did tune one of my guitars with the KLIQ MetroPitch and then compared the accuracy of the tuned guitar with a different brand tuner and they both matched. So I'd rate the accuracy and ease of use excellent. The KLIQ red-green display is easy to see - much better than my other tuner. The included protective sleeve is a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Rob C.

customer_reviews.title: Does not work when tuning harps.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing in details said MetroPitch does not work with harp tuning. My time was wasted trying to figure out why it wasn't working. Company offered to refund my money with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: january blandford

customer_reviews.title: All in-one device!
customer_reviews.text: This metronome/tuner had great reviews and a very reasonable price. The seller followed up with me with a "welcome" email and additional instructions for use of the device. After I received it I tried it out and it worked just like the item description said it should. It even came with the batteries so I could try it out right away. I couldn't ask for a better deal. My old (10yr plus) electronic tuner was about $20 and ran on a 9v and didn't do half of what this great gadget does. I'm a very happy customer. To the other reviewers who described how to work the tuner and showed the videos - thank you! Very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Tranquility

customer_reviews.title: Love this device!
customer_reviews.text: I especially like the feature that takes voice input and indicates perfect pitch. Great for people taking voice lessons - I use it mainly as a metronome for keyboard. Would recommend it to anyone learning a musical instrument - especially kids.
customer_reviews.author: D. B. S.

customer_reviews.title: ... on my cell phone was running down the battery pretty fast. This device seems to work for quite ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because the metronome app on my cell phone was running down the battery pretty fast. This device seems to work for quite a while before discharging the batteries. It is easy to set tempo and loudness. I don't use the tuner function (I use a different tuner that attaches to my guitar), but I tried it and it seems to work well. The batteries seem to give quite a long use.
customer_reviews.author: geedub52

customer_reviews.title: Not long-lasted for our student clarinet player
customer_reviews.text: This metronome was ok but not durable. We found it misbehaved fairly regularly, and even after various battery changes and restarts it was just not great. The screen frequently turned off or faded and eventually just didn't work. It definitely took a few dives off the music stand, but nothing brutal. It seemed fragile at best, and we won't be getting this kind as a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Tuttle

customer_reviews.title: Not Useful to This Musician
customer_reviews.text: I like the dial on the front, to choose the metronome tempo, but all the other functions are awkward. The tuner display is jumpy and hard to read. There is no way to turn the metronome on and off, other than switch functions. There is only one sound, an annoying beep, for the metronome. In short, not user or musician friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Bassman 17

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, almost perfect tuner.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tuner. Recognizes the note you play much faster than a phone app. Its display is easy to read in a dark room. Only wish you could switch between the tone generator and tuner with a single key press of the function key. The way it works, you have to hit the function key twice for that switch. The first press starts the metronome.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfgang

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mainly for the tuner. I got this in red and it is a beautiful color. I've giving this 4 stars because when I'm using it for purposes of intonation, this device has a difficult time picking up notes played on the E string. This is not a huge deal since I am being taught not to heavily depend on a tuning device for intonation. The device is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Tee32

customer_reviews.title: Great tool! Wish it were louder.
customer_reviews.text: Wish it were louder! Otherwise awesome and pretty! I use this in music lessons with many students. They are fascinated by it... And if students drop it, my phone doesn’t get broken (as with metronome apps).
customer_reviews.author: J-Bird

customer_reviews.title: Great device, but not for piano
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this is a great little device. However, for my needs, I was a little disappointed. I wanted a chromatic tuner that could handle the full range of a piano. It cannot pick up the lowest and highest octaves even though the instructions indicate otherwise. For most people, this shouldn’t be an issue, but it happened to be for me. I do love this device, but I will have to stick with using an app on my phone to tune my piano.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: KLIQ Music Gear Loves Their Customers!
customer_reviews.text: The product arrive on the date it was scheduled to arrive. I am very pleased with the product but most importantly amazed with the seller Ms. Laura Bergman from KLIQ Music Gear with a follow up email with an attachment on product manual and support. Thank you Laura for taking the time to reach out to your customers!
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Guerrero

customer_reviews.title: Died after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: This worked well for only 3 months and then it broke. It turns off randomly and half of the functions aren't there/don't light up. New batteries don't help. I'm very disappointed in this product, as I am unable to return it because it is past the one month return window. A waste of money and now I have to find a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Jilla

customer_reviews.title: Useful and accurate. Allowing you to tune instrument right at home with metronome.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, accurate and very useful. I like that it includes both metronome and tunning functions. Technically you can just download app to do the same but it is not as accurate and I can give it to my kids without worries about batteries or crushing or just causing distraction. Money well spent in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: PRODUCT REVIEW
customer_reviews.text: Great metronome... for those who like electronics its user friendly and effective for tuning...
customer_reviews.author: lui

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality not sure if it picks up the correct pitch but l don't use it for that. The metronome is very easy to use and the beat rate can be changed quickly. My only nit pick it's the volume it's not that high a max. The included carry bag is welcomed.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis49

customer_reviews.title: KLIQ clicks with me!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product sight unseen. I based my purchase on the features of the product description and all the previous reviews that are posted. I must say that all the reviews were absolutely correct and this is one fantastic piece of equipment at a great price. All the reviews were five stars when I purchased mine. I noticed today that one person has since rated it at four stars, but yet he really liked it and did not have anything negative to say about it. I guess that some people can't give a five star rating even if it was the best invention since sliced bread!! It's a great product and you will be happy if you buy one!
customer_reviews.author: H. W. Bulford

customer_reviews.title: Works well, accurate but no Harmonica instructions.
customer_reviews.text: Nice product. Tested it against a super tuned piano and every note was right on green! No instructions for a Harmonica but used it in Chromatic and only 2 of 10 notes were green, all the others were way off. Guess I have some work to do to get the harmonica in tune, if I can.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Roderique

customer_reviews.title: Compact, easy to use with an added benefit.
customer_reviews.text: I thought it might be too small, but it fits perfectly onto a small space on top of my keyboard. I will use it when I practice as well as when I play in my church. I play gospel and the service gets lively sometimes. I can't imagine how, but every now and then the tempo mysteriously increases... the tick tock thru my earbuds should help immensely tho it my give me Tourette's syndrome. Cool little unit.
customer_reviews.author: dochence

customer_reviews.title: Tap function is worthless
customer_reviews.text: I like to be able to tap in but it simply doesn't work on this unit. When I want to determine the BPM of a particular song, the values this metronome returns from one press to the next vary wildly, up to +/- 15 BPM either way. The only thing I can guess is that it's averaging across only the last two or three presses rather than a larger number. I am also not pleased with how hard you have to press the power button to get the thing to turn on. All in all, I'm not impressed and can't recommend this metronome.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: KLIQ MetroPitch Tuner
customer_reviews.text: I received this product yesterday and I'm very pleased with it. Is as described. It comes with a cloth case which is heavier than I thought it would be. I also purchase the hard case that is recommended for this product and was also very pleased with it. Further more upon receiving this product, I promptly received an email from a company rep. thanking me for choosing them over there competitors and also informing me that if I had any questions or concerns I should feel free to contact her. She also attacked a digital copy of the owners manual for my viewing. Overall, I am very pleased with my purchase of this Item and the customer service thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Great tuner, metronome and reference tone generator
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, little tuner, metronome & reference tone generator, gadget. I bought it for my son, in aiding with his cello tuning/playing. He was immediately "wow'ed" by the cool LED display and having the screen lit up in green, when having the tuning string at the prefect pitch, is a great feature. I like the fact that it uses commonly found batteries/I can use rechargeable batteries. Time will tell how long the unit will last, but first impressions are awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great Tuner/Metronome Device
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised. At first I was thinking of giving it four stars because I was used to a clicking metronome and not one that beeps. However, after only a few days, I no longer think about it. When practicing (in a quiet room) I like the tuner much better than using a clip on. EDIT: When I had a slight problem, they were quick to respond with the solution. Great product & great company!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I Can Use it with Focusrite/Scarlett and Protools to create real, usable click tracks !
customer_reviews.text: Likes: * It works really well and is easy to figure out, even with the instructions. * By using the headphone out and its volume, I can plug into my Scarlett and then create a wav file in Protools. * I needed help with that last thing above and emailed them at 11pm. I got an answer by midnight! Needs help: * To hook it up to an interface, you will need a jumper that is not supplied. * The instructions are being modified at my suggestion to explain the above. * It was a little bit more expensive than similar items. I'd still buy it again (and I did!) just because of the help I got.
customer_reviews.author: mark darden

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my wife, who is a Choir Teacher & Pianist, and she likes it. User friendly and has more functions than her last one.
customer_reviews.author: R. Perrin

customer_reviews.title: Use this every day!
customer_reviews.text: Our little new violin player finds the "tuner" function extremely helpful and very easy to use. She is 7 and only started violin lessons a few month ago. Being an active girl, her strings gets loose often. I used to have to tune her violin everyday; now she does it herself. There are other functionalities that we are yet to discover, but already very happy about it!
customer_reviews.author: Techshopper

customer_reviews.title: EAST TO READ WHILE TUNING
customer_reviews.text: VERY GOOD quality easy to use work perfect would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Roger Mcafee

customer_reviews.title: Please read this review before buying!!!
customer_reviews.text: I received this item yesterday and purchased it as a gift ask I do not know how the product performs, however I just opened an email from the manufacturer of the item which was surprising, the email was thanking me for the purchase and included digital copies of the manual of the item I bought... A welcome surprise which is why I will definitely remember and appreciate!! ***I feel it is unfair to give 5 stars not knowing how the item performs in totality!!***
customer_reviews.author: CapeCodder

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought for daughter to learn trombone. Far too complex for her needs and she could not hear it. While more expensive, the SoundBrenner works out way better for her and she can feel the vibration rather than trying very hard to hear it with her loud instrument.
customer_reviews.author: ShopperLife

customer_reviews.title: Portable and Useful
customer_reviews.text: Useful, portable, practical. The metronome is full of features and is loud enough for classical guitar and such instruments. Tuner is friendly and has a pretty decent tolerance of +\- 1 cent which is fine for fast tunings. Wide range tone generator (A0 to C8), which is not common in devices of this size. The dial is great to easily set the tempo, tone, beats, etc. It’d be great to have and updated version of this practical device in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Marco

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says, but is rather quiet.
customer_reviews.text: Pitch detection is good, Metronome is also easy to use, but is too quiet to hear over the piano, even on max settings. I had to hook it up to an extra speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: My hubby Loves This one ;-)
customer_reviews.text: Thank you for the quick shipment. My hubby loves this one. He is a musician and it's very helpful for him. Very easy to use and the little bag to keep this so nice. Thank you again.
customer_reviews.author: RubuDina

customer_reviews.title: I like to buy shampoo+shower in one
customer_reviews.text: I like to buy shampoo+shower in one, so might as well buy all instruments in one device, I thought. However, this tuner/metronome is too complicated for my brain to use. At least their customer service is good and let me get a refund. The return shipping cost $6 though even with the prime membership.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonIsTheBest

customer_reviews.title: Tuning and Timing
customer_reviews.text: The product is as described. I use it to tune my bass to 440 Hz and it is accurate. I have used the metronome only briefly, but it appears to be very functional. The directions for use could be a tad more in depth, but what is written will get you up and running with the KLIQ. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R. Piche

customer_reviews.title: Tuner portion doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Tuner doesn’t work metronome does poor quality preinspection process before shipping
customer_reviews.author: Tech Trainer

customer_reviews.title: Great versatile tuner
customer_reviews.text: Great tuner. I wanted a tuner that was easy to use and more importantly, easy to read from more than 2 ft away. This fits the bill nicely. I wasn't looking for a metronome, but it has already come in handy on a couple of occasions. I will probably never use the tone generator, but it is nice to know it is included should the need arise. I haven't really tried out every single setting, because I just wanted a nice portable tuner and that is my primary use.
customer_reviews.author: Shopping Angel

customer_reviews.title: This thing is junk (you don't always get what you pay for)
customer_reviews.text: If you're buying this to finely tune an instrument, don't waste your money. It must have an "in tune" range of at least 20 cents, but I suspect it's even worse. In order to use it with any consistency from string to string you have to tune everything to where the meter bounces between flat and in tune and even then it is not accurate. It's a kiddie tuner with lots of built in eye candy.
customer_reviews.author: Vindaloo

customer_reviews.title: Love it. The tuning works much better that the ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. The tuning works much better that the Korg unit I used to have. The display is very easy to read. The job wheel to change the tempo is much easier that having up/down buttons. The metronome seems to have all the features I could possibly want. I'm using it with an electric and an acoustic mandolin. The electric one tunes well plugged into it, the acoustic is fine being picked up by its mic.
customer_reviews.author: Mole_Catcher

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a metronome wth no annoying ads or interruptions!
customer_reviews.text: Nice metronome. Got it to replace using the free app on my smart phone. Seems to keep the beat accurately, as I compared it to two other metronomes at 126. The audible clicks and how to lights blink are taking a little getting used to. I'm using it to practice with other orchestra members.
customer_reviews.author: ETLongIsland

customer_reviews.title: A bit fiddly but...
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit fiddly to figure out for key changes for different instruments, but once I figured it out, works like a champ. The display is very helpful when trying to play in tune- Seems well constructed, and very accurate as near as I can tell
customer_reviews.author: Tucson EV owner

customer_reviews.title: easy to use'
customer_reviews.text: We already have 2 loud metronome, 2 metronome with tuner but my daughter wanted to have something 'easy to read, easy to use', clear, loud. This is working well and compact enough to keep in her violin case. I compared it with Korg since it is the most popular brand. I watched video reviews, read reviews and came up with KLIQ. I'm glad I chose this.
customer_reviews.author: H. Godfrey

customer_reviews.title: Very good BUT...
customer_reviews.text: It's a very good tuner and a very good metronome, and it fits easily in my guitar case. I do wish I'd known before buying that the 1/4" input only works with the tuner and NOT with the metronome; i.e. if you're a guitar player who needs to practice through headphones, this isn't the metronome for you.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Very user friendly and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this because it’s user friendly and easy to operate. It has a little folding stand to place it near you when tuning or when using it to keep a beat. It also comes with a handy little cloth case.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working fast, cannot use both features at once
customer_reviews.text: Buy the korg metronome! It’s more durable AND practical Cannot use metronome and tuner at the same time! (Korg does this) Broke within a few weeks, completely stopped working after being dropped a couple of times. Tuner shows that it is “in tune” once it is about 5 hz within pitch. This isn’t always good enough if you’re really trying to be precise. I’m giving it 2 stars because the speakers are loud and the drone is kinda fun to play with.
customer_reviews.author: karkar

customer_reviews.title: Great tuner, and metronome, etc
customer_reviews.text: Really nice tuner, feels solid, foot it's plastic; it's a wire stand which seem less prone to snap off super easy to use and really feature-rich. A staple.
customer_reviews.author: J. Drumheller

customer_reviews.title: Like the other options on it also
customer_reviews.text: for the price this little gadget fills the bill, really helped me learn how to tune and keep my guitar in tune in a second. it also tunes several other instruments. Like the other options on it also. Comes in a nice velvet case with instructions and online services!!
customer_reviews.author: traycee swope

customer_reviews.title: Just like the old days !!
customer_reviews.text: It works great , just like the old days Use to use summerly on back in the days , So easy to use . All I can say " Keep on ROCKIN "
customer_reviews.author: Ronald R.

customer_reviews.title: Volume Intermittent
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I had to return it. When I opened it and began to use it, everything was fine. But then I noticed some problems with the volume. As I tried to increase or decrease the volume, it would cut out completely... Probably a manufacturing flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P. Walther

customer_reviews.title: Junk pile
customer_reviews.text: Bar none the worst tuner I have owned in 30 years of being a musician. Regardless of the mode it can’t tell E from G. (Let alone tune 440a immediately after setting with another known good tuner) The metronome works though. Hard pass on buying this.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Great product; most excellent customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Bright display. Great multi-functions. Only downside (for me) was just using sharps for accidentals and not flats since I'm a bit prejudiced against sharps with my C instrument (flute). :-) Best customer service ever!
customer_reviews.author: John Sigwald

customer_reviews.title: Good Tuner/Metronome
customer_reviews.text: I love that this tuner/metronome allow my 10yo to practice without mom’s phone. It is VERY difficult to get the tuner to light up green (note in tune), which is good and bad: good, in that you have to be very precise; bad, in that it’s so difficult I feel like my son doesn’t always try.
customer_reviews.author: Luvmy2QTz

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: So far I'm really liking this tuner. The vizability is very is very good in not well lit areas, as well as the stability of the indicator on the screen for tuning guitar. Accuracy seems to be spot on too. I tune up with this tuner, then plug into my amp, strum a chord, and it's on. I've used the metronome for practice at home, and like that too. It goes loud enough to practice with it for sure. There's a little learning curve for the use of the buttons, but I caught on quick, which means most anyone else would too. I would surely recommend this tuner, for it's quality, and reasonable price as well.
customer_reviews.author: mark gerisch

customer_reviews.title: Having it all in one is awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is a much better tool for rehearsal than a standard metronome. Having the tuner and tone generator all in one is really helpful and I plan on using this a lot when I start getting in shape to record a new album.
customer_reviews.author: Donnie Carter

customer_reviews.title: Once on it’s great, but battery compartment problems
customer_reviews.text: Works well once on but battery compartment is finicky and if the unit is tapped slightly or you use the stand, the connection is lost with the batteries and the whole thing powers off. Very frustrating for my 7 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Sputnik

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!!!
customer_reviews.text: First I tried a cheaper Eno tuner, which was advertised as specifically for violins, but it doesn't tune correctly! Then I bought this more expensive KLIQ tuner and it works perfectly! TOTALLY worth it to spend the few extra bucks. I wasted money on that other one.
customer_reviews.author: C. Yuen

customer_reviews.title: A good quality product.
customer_reviews.text: I use it as a metronome, and easy to operate. I love it because it’s small enough to fit in pocket and it has a pouch. Plus it has a tuning capacity. It’s worth every dollar, and I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Lee G.

customer_reviews.title: Nice tuner.
customer_reviews.text: Accurate ( I checked it against a tuning fork) as a tuner and tone generator. I'm happy. I like the 1/4 in. input/output jacks, I can run an instrument directly in or generate a reference to check another tuner, since I know this one is accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: NO longer works after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: This product no longer works after 3 months of occasional uses. It turned on then off immediately. Replacing batteries would not resolve the problem. UPDATE: The seller KLIQ Music Gear was extremely helpful when I contacted them regarding the problem. They prompted sent me a replacement unit as well as included a MetroPitch Digital Tuner! I truly appreciate their service and would give them 5 stars for their excellent response to replace a defective unit.
customer_reviews.author: Minh Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tuner! I would recommend this to anyone looking for a quality tuner without spending a lot of money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: KLIQ MetroPitch - Metronome Tuner for All Instruments
customer_reviews.text: Nice tuner...wife plays violin in two orchestras and loves it. looks good...fast shipping...good value. rlw
customer_reviews.author: RLW

customer_reviews.title: Big problem with tuner
customer_reviews.text: I received my tuner and no matter what I due when i try to tune an "F" it will not come up. The tuner jumps from "e" to "g". Everything else works fine but this is a HUGE problem.
customer_reviews.author: lgdgh

product_meta.title: KLIQ MetroPitch - Metronome Tuner for All Instruments - with Guitar, Bass, Violin, Ukulele, and Chromatic Tuning Modes - Tone Generator - Carrying Pouch Included, Black
feature_bullets: 3 IN 1 DEVICE: The MetroPitch combines a Tuner, a Metronome, and a Tone Generator, all housed in a pocket-sized device. The included carrying pouch makes for easy transport to your next gig or practice.
VERSATILE TUNER: The fast and accurate tuner boasts a wide range of A0-C8, various tuning modes, transposition settings, and pitch calibration. So whichever instrument you play, it's got you covered!
TAP TEMPO METRONOME: With a broad range of 30-250 Beats Per Minute, tap tempo, and various beats and rhythm patterns, this metronome will improve your timing in a rich variety of musical styles.

EASY TO USE: The intuitive JOG Dial let's you literally dial in your desired tempo quickly and easily. It also allows for making swift pitch selection in the Tone Generator, among many other functions.
3-YEAR MANUFACTURER GUARANTEE: In the unlikely event the KLIQ MetroPitch breaks or stops working, we'll replace it or give you 100% of your money back, no questions asked.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,780 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
